item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/plan-of-action/#comment-341">kindredspirit23</a>.
Hey, this is a great idea! I'll be adding a glossary of all jargony words used now - thanks for the idea! (*figures out if I can acknowledge kindredsprit23 in thesis*) ;)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to kindredspirit23.

Hey, this is a great idea! I’ll be adding a glossary of all jargony words used now – thanks for the idea! (*figures out if I can acknowledge kindredsprit23 in thesis*) ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: kindredspirit23
item.dc:creator: kindredspirit23
item.description: Two things, neither of which may have a whit to do with anything: First, the single ellipses around event at the beginning. I tend to use them also and have been told not to. I was told, basically, that if I wrote correctly, the emphasis would not be necessary. Second, are you allowed to put a basic glossary of some of the elementary words such as "tetrapod"? I can infer the basic meaning from the word itself, but it would be nice to have just some of them defined for ease of reading. I am sure the readers of your paper do not need such aides. Just a couple of thoughts - well written! Scott
item.content:encoded:
Two things, neither of which may have a whit to do with anything:
First, the single ellipses around event at the beginning. I tend to use them also and have been told not to. I was told, basically, that if I wrote correctly, the emphasis would not be necessary.
Second, are you allowed to put a basic glossary of some of the elementary words such as “tetrapod”? I can infer the basic meaning from the word itself, but it would be nice to have just some of them defined for ease of reading. I am sure the readers of your paper do not need such aides.
Just a couple of thoughts – well written!
Scott
